image.altText: A court sketch of a man with glasses sitting in the dock

props.synopsis: A man who shot an unarmed trespasser four times at close range before burying him two metres underground inside a shed north of Adelaide in 2023 is found guilty of murder.

title.children: Man found guilty of shooting murder of unarmed trespasser he buried in shed

image.altText: AFL player Zak Butters running and dropping the football, preparing to punt it away

props.synopsis: Port Adelaide vice-captain Zak Butters will be sidelined for at least six weeks after having knee surgery.

title.children: Power vice-captain to miss several matches following surgery

image.altText: Firefighters in the field.

props.synopsis: South Australians are warned to prepare for an extended high-risk bushfire season across several districts as hot, dry conditions show no signs of abating.

title.children: No end in sight to SA bushfire danger after record dry spell

image.altText: A building at Whyalla steelworks.

props.synopsis: The SA government had been pursuing GFG Alliance over unpaid royalties since the beginning of last year — and made repeated threats to suspend the company's mining permits, according to documents obtained under Freedom of Information.

title.children: SA government had been chasing GFG Alliance over debts since early 2024

image.altText: A little corella looks down from a gum tree

props.synopsis: Kangaroo Island residents say their children are at risk of disease from little corella poo splashing across play equipment and school lunch areas, but the education department refuses to consider a cull.

title.children: 'Thousands and thousands' of little corellas causing big poo problem

image.altText: Stewart Johnston, standing in a crowd, frowns as he speaks to reporters.

props.synopsis: Stewart Johnston, who remained a high-profile advocate for reform in the aged care sector following the abuse scandal at Oakden, has been sentenced to just over a year in jail after earlier pleading guilty to a charge of knowingly possessing child exploitation material.

title.children: Oakden campaigner Stewart Johnston jailed for possessing child exploitation material

image.altText: Thanasi Kokkinakis gives thumbs up in a bed

props.synopsis: Thanasi Kokkinakis has undergone surgery to try to correct the "mental and physical torture" he was suffering through a long-standing pectoral injury.

title.children: Kokkinakis has surgery in bid to end 'mental and physical torture'

image.altText: overhead satellite photo of houses adjacent sand dunes

props.synopsis: A Tennyson resident says plans for a coastal walk from Grange to Tennyson reveal a 40-metre blockage in the dunes that link it to Stage One of the project.

title.children: Adelaide walkway plans show 'blockage' in beach suburb dunes

image.altText: A woman and man with serious expressions stand close together in front of a caravan park

props.synopsis: After rebuilding their Riverland caravan park in the wake of a devastating flood, Barbara and Geoff Calvert are facing a new challenge — surging insurance premiums.

title.children: South Australians deal with rising insurance premiums following floods and fires

image.altText: Young smiling girl, braces wears blue tee with surf culture australia written, holds surfboard, house, white sand in background.

props.synopsis: Home Education Association says the number of people choosing to homeschool their children is growing. However, an academic warns it may not be for everyone.

title.children: Why do so many Australians homeschool their children?

image.altText: A man hunches over a reel-to-reel tape player.

props.synopsis: Samuel Beckett's plays challenged the norm in the mid-20th century, so it's fitting that a director who champions new writers should open the Adelaide Festival with his major work, Krapp's Last Tape.

title.children: Samuel Beckett an ongoing champion for new writing at Adelaide Festival

image.altText: A man wearing a blue hair net and a dark blue shirt with Vili's logo on it takes a tray of pies out the oven

props.synopsis: The wife of Vili Milisits, the founder of one of South Australia's most popular bakeries, has filed a wrongful death lawsuit against a neuropsychologist who she says wrongfully diagnosed her husband with Alzheimer's disease.

title.children: Wife of Vili's bakery founder claims he was misdiagnosed with Alzheimer's before his death

image.altText: A crowd of protesters, with one holding a sign reading 'enough is enough'.

props.synopsis: SA Police respond to 100 domestic incidents and issue nine intervention orders on average each day, the state's Royal Commission into Domestic, Family and Sexual Violence has heard.

title.children: SA Police respond to 100 domestic incidents a day, royal commission hears

image.altText: gene hackman and his wife betsy arakawa

props.synopsis: Hackman, his wife Betsy Arakawa and one of their three dogs were found dead by a maintenance worker who had arrived to do routine work at their Santa Fe home on Wednesday.

title.children: Police document reveals how bodies of Gene Hackman and Betsy Arakawa were found

image.altText: A military jeep full of Israeli soldiers driving down a roadway in Israel.

props.synopsis: The Israeli military says it failed to "imagine such a scenario" before the October 7, 2023 attacks, in terms of size, scale and "brutality".

title.children: Israeli military releases findings of probe into October 7 attack

image.altText: A man smiles for the camera

props.synopsis: Nicole Williams pleaded guilty to attempted aggravated burglary and accessory after the fact to murder for her involvement in the death of Glenn Walewicz, and was today sentenced to seven years in jail.

title.children: It was a killing that baffled police. Now its mastermind has been jailed

image.altText: Chinese Ambassador to Australia, Xiao Qian being interviewed by ABC in Hobart

props.synopsis: In his first comments since this month's arrival of a People's Liberation Army-Navy (PLA-N) taskforce, Ambassador Xiao Qian declared there was no reason for China to "pose a threat to Australia".

title.children: China insists its navy poses 'no threat' to Australia

image.altText: Penny Wong speaks while standing in front of US and Australian flags

props.synopsis: Beijing has signalled a remarkable shift in approach towards Canberra, one that appears aimed at bolstering Labor's prospects in the looming federal election.

title.children: China credits Labor, not the Coalition, with 'digging the well'

image.altText: an art deco brick apartment building against a blue sky

props.synopsis: Ceiling motifs inspired by Australian flora, koalas carved by hand into the fireplaces, stained glass windows — the city's "most modern" apartments were something from another world.

title.children: The changing world around one of Australia's first 'art deco' apartments

image.altText: Picture of Australian one dollar coins stacked on top of note currency

props.synopsis: Meanwhile, speculation is rife about Star's future and Dan Murphy's owner has posted lower profits after strikes hit its liquor sales. Follow the day's events and insights as they happen with our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Aussie dollar slips and ASX trading down on more Trump tariff threats

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Conservative news operator buys up 7 Tasmania

image.altText: A man with a white beard stands in front of a brown wall

props.synopsis: NSW's public mental health system is failing patients, Australia's leading psychiatrist warns, following a mass resignation of psychiatrists and the shutdown of hospital beds.

title.children: 'We can't give up': Urgent call to act on mental health by leading psychiatrist

image.altText: Runny paoched eggs on toast with tomato.

props.synopsis: Egg farmers and market analysts warn increased consumer demand and ongoing avian influenza issues are to blame for current egg shortages, which could continue for at least another three years.

title.children: Expect egg shortage, high prices to last years, farmers tell shoppers

image.altText: A close up of Andrew Tate speaking into a reporter's microphone at an airport

props.synopsis: The brothers are facing serious charges in Romania and are being sued in the UK for over allegations of sexual violence and physical abuse.

title.children: Accused rapist Andrew Tate flies to the US after travel restrictions lifted

image.altText: Brendan Lang in front of an air-conditioning unit

props.synopsis: Analysis by international think tank InfluenceMap has looked at how the gas industry has pushed back against efforts in Victoria to transition away from gas as part of a global campaign to keep households hooked on the fuel.

title.children: The fossil lobby wants you to stay hooked on gas using this 'playbook'

image.altText: A woman with dark hair in a red dress on a dance floor, eyes closed, smiling,

props.synopsis: We asked a film critic and mathematician who will win the big gongs at the upcoming Academy Awards.

title.children: Oscar tips from a film critic and a mathematician

image.altText: A portrait image of Will Taylor.

props.synopsis: Former professional Australian rules football players and those in the footy community have continued the call for an AFL men's mental health round, saying it could be one of the most consequential moves the league could make.

title.children: How a popular AFL content creator wants mental health barriers 'broken down'

image.altText: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un smiles in the snow with hands in pockets next to military leaders

props.synopsis: A $US1.5 billion heist on leading cryptocurrency exchange Bybit is the work of North Korean state-sponsored hackers, according to the FBI.

title.children: FBI says North Korea stole $US1.5b in cryptocurrency

image.altText: a woman uses a pencil to draw on a colourful map

props.synopsis: Newly released videos show evidence involving "confection" used by the Environmental Defenders Office in its failed legal bid to halt Santos's Barossa gas pipeline west of the Tiwi Islands.

title.children: Videos show EDO evidence slammed by judge in failed Santos challenge

image.altText: Volodymyr Zelenskiy walking next to Donald Trump, who is talking with his hands outstretched

props.synopsis: Donald Trump wants to "recoup" US aid money sent to help Ukraine defend itself against Russian invaders, while Volodymyr Zelenskyy wants security assurances for his country.

title.children: Trump and Zelenskyy are meeting over a minerals deal. It could be tense

image.altText: A group of young women sitting at a dinner table, laughing together.

props.synopsis: It can be easy to lean on your partner for your social needs but what are the downsides of that and how can you create your own separate social life to your partner.

title.children: How and why to start doing things without your partner

image.altText: Single quantum computing chip

props.synopsis: Amazon has released a prototype quantum chip called Ocelot, which the company says could be used to create a powerful quantum computer using less resources than its competitors.

title.children: Amazon unveils quantum chip with solution to 'eye-watering' error problem

image.altText: Independent MPs stand in a group at a press conference.

props.synopsis: The current crossbench is making no promises to guarantee support to either Labor or Coalition in a hung parliament — with nearly all saying they would force a minority government to deal with them bill by bill, and retain their right to withdraw support.

title.children: Crossbenchers say hung parliament would have to negotiate bill by bill

image.altText: Illustration of a dark-haired person reclining on a yellow safe with a book in hand; a coffee table and plant in the foreground

props.synopsis: There are hidden family stories, and tales of love and loss both real and imagined in this month's best books, as recommended by ABC Arts critics and readers.

title.children: Eight books that knocked our critics' socks off this month
